abstract: Federal lawsuit filed by Campaign for Southern Equality, Family Equality Council and four same-sex couples is challenging Mississippi's ban on adoptions by same-sex couples, last of its kind in country; legal experts predict law will be overturned by court in wake of Supreme Court ruling establishing same-sex marriage as right, indication of swift progress made on issue.
lead_paragraph: The ban is the only one of its kind in the nation, and experts say it is unlikely to hold up in court in the wake of the Supreme Court’s same-sex marriage decision.

headline.main: Mississippi Ban on Adoptions by Same-Sex Couples Is Challenged

snippet: The ban is the only one of its kind in the nation, and experts say it is unlikely to hold up in court in the wake of the Supreme Court’s same-sex marriage decision.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
